solution_line_template: Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends ${budget} / {food_divisor} = $<<{budget}/{food_divisor}={food_cost}>>{food_cost} on food.
He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends ${budget} / {supplies_divisor} = $<<{budget}/{supplies_divisor}={supplies_cost}>>{supplies_cost} on supplies.
Thus, he spends ${budget} - ${food_cost} - ${supplies_cost} = $<<{budget}-{food_cost}-{supplies_cost}={wages_cost}>>{wages_cost} on employee wages every month.
